alert.note: Alert for Olmsted; Wabasha (Minnesota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS LaCrosse (Southwestern Wisconsin, Southeastern Minnesota, and Northeast Iowa)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 23 at 1:58PM CDT by NWS LaCrosse
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Olmsted and central Wabasha Counties through 230 PM CDT... At 156 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Plainview, or 16 miles southwest of Wabasha, moving northeast at 65 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Kellogg around 210 PM CDT. Wabasha around 215 PM CDT. Other locations impacted by this storm include Jarrett, Ringe, Pioneer Campground, Zumbro Bottoms Campground, Potsdam, Conception, and West Albany. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
